reviews.review_msg: Lance is exceptionally passionate about what he teaches and made even the dull subject matter interesting to learn. He explains concepts thoroughly and seems to really enjoy teaching. My only complaint would be that the workload and the amount of reading and supplementary material was overwhelming at times, but the deadlines were fair.

One of my favorite profs. This course wasnt an easy A, but the topics were interesting and all the readings and lectures were laid out clearly. Lance is really kind and receptive to questions, and the learning expectations were totally reasonable. 10/10 would recommend.
Caring professor who is easily and happy to be accessible outside and after classes. Helps you with whatever you need help with, and is perfectly reasonable given any circumstances. Very passionate.

Is very nice as he tries to give you a helping hand when you ask for it. Will try his best to answer your questions without giving you answers so at times it may not be too much information of help. Posts lectures online but may need to attend class to write your own notes.

Lance is a very nice guy and seems very passionate about limnology but the class was very disorganized. no midterm, only presentation, term paper, and final and lab assignments. It was very hard to figure out what to study for or how to answer test questions. Same with the paper, very vague and broad topics given. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS ALONE!
